body.p:
Trigg Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } August Term 1865
Loftin Michell

The Grand Jury of Trigg County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Loftin Michell of the Crime of Robbery. Committed as follows viz. The said Loftin Michell on the 10th day of August 1864 in the County aforesaid willfully and feloniously took one horse the personal property of Elvington De Graffenreid from his presence and possession and against his will by putting him in fear of Some immediate injury to his person from violence, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

W Wharton
Foreman Grand Jury
E. P. Campbell
Attorney for the Commonwealth.

Information given by
Elvington DeGraffenreid
Dr G H. Jefferson
J J Tomlinson
W Rich
J. E DeGraffenreid
Bench Warrant to issue & bail fixed at $400.

Comth
vs } Indictment for Robbery
Loftin Michell
A True Bill
W Wharton
foreman Grand Jury
Returned into Court and filed 5th Sept 1865 6th Bench Warrant issued --

A True Copy,
Att R A. Burnett C T C C
